body: Squash the commits that would be great
I think home.css should be in a /styles/ directory but that can wait until after POC

@jj-nguyen I exported the database into SQL statements, so I didn't write the actual SQL that you see in `database.sql`.  And regarding table names, it doesn't really matter. Is there a certain nomenclature you want to follow?
Other than that, LGTM!

Structure of individual modules LGTM. 

For the overall structure of the project, do we want a certain directory structure? For example, a /config/ folder for SensitiveInfo, a /migrations/ folder for database updates, maybe /views/ for later, etc.? Probably don't need to solve this in this PR, but something to consider.
LGTM! Good work! :fire:
Please include steps on how we can test this (and any specific test cases you ran) in your description.

The following changes need to go into the description or the description should just refer to the README because what you have in the README is solid

> * `git checkout db_migrations_support`
Should be `git checkout -b db_migrations_support`

> * `git pull`
Should be `git pull origin db_migrations_support`

> * `db-migrate up`
Prior to this command, you need to copy and fill in the required fields from `database-sample.json` into `database.json`
I wondering, should the logic that you have in the endpoint for /signin be in the SignIn.delegate method?
@KevinHardy-Cooper All comments have been addressed in the latest commit.
awesome, squash the commits (call me on fb for a step-by-step) and then I'll approve it!
resolved
resolved
what configfile? Do you mean SensitiveInfo.js?

Above error has been resolved (had to do with SensitiveInfo).
